snippet: The rebels on Friday warned travelers against using the airport, reports said, as diplomacy between the United States and Russia appeared to have made little progress.
abstract: Syrian rebels warn travelers against using Damascus airport, as diplomacy between United States and Russia appears to yield little progress.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD, ALAN COWELL and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, Alan Cowell from London and Michael R. Gordon from Belfast, Northern Ireland. Hala Droubi contributed reporting from Dubai, United Arab Emirates, and Sebnem Arsu from Islahiye, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: The rebels on Friday warned travelers against using the airport, reports said, as diplomacy between the United States and Russia appeared to have made little progress.

headline.seo: Rebels Declare Damascus Airport a ‘Fair Target,’ Reports Say
headline.main: Amid Battles in Suburbs, Syrian Rebels Warn Travelers to Avoid Damascus Airport
headline.print_headline: Amid Battles in Suburbs, Syrian Rebels Warn Travelers to Avoid Damascus Airport

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
